text.__SUMMARY__: Acacia pravifolia (common name Coil-pod Wattle) is a shrub of the genus Acacia and the subgenus Phyllodineae. It is native to an area in the Wheatbelt, Great Southern and Goldfields-Esperance regions of Western Australia.The prickly shrub typically grows to a height of 0.1 to 1.2 metres (0.3 to 3.9 ft). It blooms from August to October and produces yellow flowers.
